column5: Hey everyone,  Just wondering if anyone knows the contact info for tackle distributors for fishing tackle? My friend just bought a marina, and is looking to stock some fishing gear as well.  Any help is much appreciated.    *Stoty
Im not sure if they are still around. KTL (Ken's Tackle) Thats were we use to get a lot of our misc stuff from. Not sure how much you have to buy to start an account.

no probs man if you need anything and according to " internet for dummies"  http://www.alltheweb.com is the best search engine! has heuristic search for individual words ..I find it much better than Google
Try this site and tell your friend to call Bill he is great guy and has a great selection  www.wallysbait.com
tell your friend wholesalers don't go through middle men to find products
yes KTL is still around working at a bait store we has triple S , KTL and DFS   Triple S is in U.S tho
Any links/contact info for Triple S or DFS?
DFS is in Scarborough: (416) 332-1740. David Boehm is the guy you want to speak with.

Your buddy needs to understand his client. (What's in the lake).  The way for him to make the most return is buy direct. There will be minimum orders $500, $1000. Redwing Tackle, Lucky Strike, and almost every company sell direct to retails.  The next level is KTL, Marrice, Perry's Tackle and dozens of guys rep. small amount of products.  The standard rule is everybody makes 100%.  So if your buddy has the cash on 30 days to get best prices he will make 200% by cutting out those middle guys.  Garnet
